website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced foot spa that feels good at the end of a long day. "Toe touch" controls make the unit easy to operate.
pros: Bubbles and "waterfall" action gently massage your feet
Blue lights at the bottom of the unit are relaxing to look at
Pumice stone, foot scrubber, and massager provide further pampering
cons: While the unit will maintain water warmth, it won't heat up the water, so you'll need to fill the basin with hot water at the start

website_summaries.verdict: This waterfall foot spa treats feet with a number of settings. You can't beat the overall performance and durability for the price.
pros: A top choice for its multi-function toe-touch settings
Customize your experience just how you like it
cons: This foot spa doesn't actually heat up the water, leaving most users to pour in hot water before a session

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat water...
customer_reviews.text: The product doesn't heat the water. It says so in the instructions in the box. Yet in the product's name says it heats water. The Amazon product description says this false claim too... Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: rstoll17

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! My daughter loves pedicures and the spa service but we don't always have the time to make an appointment and go. This foot spa is awesome. It's light weight (even when filled with water) and the vibration is very relaxing. My favorite part is the splash guard because I can paint her nails with ease when her feet are placed on top. I would've loved to have given it 5 starts but the water was definitely not heated, even in slightest amount. I poured in very warm water and it was not able to retain the temperature so there's not even the slightest chance that it could heat cooler water. But, for the price, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica CastilloTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: very weak, totally not able to keep water warm. waste of money. get a 99 cents of plastic bucket will work better than this.
customer_reviews.text: What I really need is something to keep water warm, no need to keep adding hot water. It arrived last week, and I just tried it yesterday, the so call masager, was weaker than a feather going through my feet. even my electric toothbrush is better than it; and, it does not keep the water warm, not at all. After 10 minutes, the water turn to 50 degree. very disappointed. I'd rather get a 99 cents plastic bucket and believe it will work better than this. I will try to find out how can I return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of negative comments but I like it! The vibration is not intense, much more of a gentle type. The heating element is what it is, this is a $20 footbath. If you don't overfill it the water will maintain some warmth. It does not stay as hot as the water I initially added but there is some heat maintained. You do have to really search for the fill line, but that is such a minor issue I can't fault it. Bottom line this is a cheaper footbath that gives you exactly what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Erin G

customer_reviews.title: Works great! I'm happy!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described! Heating/Vibration (on and off) function keeps water warm...it does not heat, as some reviewers are unhappy about. Kept my water warm for the 20mins I soaked and massaged my tired aching feet after working 4- 14hr night shifts at the hospital in a busy PICU. I'm happy with my purchase! Also has a 1 year warranty. Better than filling 2 extra large bowls with water and having it get cold after 8mins. I highly recommend this product :)
customer_reviews.author: Medusa King

customer_reviews.title: It sucks homies don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a while back, and not really impressed. I don't usually write reviews but I decided to review this...The thing is too damn loud, the water doesn't remain heated for very long and it hurts your ankles. I would buy another product - just being honest.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I realize it is the cheapo version of a foot ...
customer_reviews.text: I realize it is the cheapo version of a foot bath, but never the less expect certain basic things to work. (1) The heat does not appear to work. I filled it with hot water and in 10 mins the water was cold. The manual says the heat function will maintain water temperature. (2) It’s very noisy. I can hardly hear the TV over the rumbling it makes. (3) The bubbles are not very strong.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B

customer_reviews.title: Just an Expensive Bucket
customer_reviews.text: Just as the other reviews said, it's okay. It is basically just a tub to soak your feet. The bubbles are just bubbles, nothing fancy... and the heat is non-existent (just like the other reviewers said). I didn't expect much but I guess for that price, I was hoping for a little more. I should have saved my money and just got a bucket to soak them in. Two stars because it arrived quickly, as described.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly loud!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re trying to relax, this is not for you. It is so loud, I’m irritated even sitting here soaking my feet. If I didn’t wear heels all day and this was easier to return I would. The positive I will say is if you put hot water in, it has been holding the heat for about 20 min now. Just so loud! I don’t get it.
customer_reviews.author: Kworth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Foot Tub!
customer_reviews.text: This has been clutch during this quarantine. Yes the bubbles are SLIGHTLY noisy and splatter a little, but it’s not a big deal. Lots of people in the reviews I read said this doesn’t keep the water hot....but I put REALLY hot water in there in the beginning, expecting it to cool off quickly based on the other reviews, and ended up having to put ice cubes in it to cool it down lol. So I feel like if you’re not soaking your feet for like 3 hours then it stays perfectly hot enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jen O.

customer_reviews.title: Great for soaking feet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to soak my feet. I innitialy had very low expectations due to the reviews and descriptions, however to my surprise it works well. The vibration can be fairly loud on wooden floors, but you learn to zone out the sound. It vibrates, no frills there, but fairly decent. Altogether, it's doing exactly what I wanted it for. I would recommend this product for those who wants simple use.
customer_reviews.author: Jd

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my husband because he always on his feet he wears a size 14 in shoes a size 15/16 But he loves it we are happy
customer_reviews.author: QuayQuay

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold heat.
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible product. Does not hold temp. Would never buy again. Directions say whatever temp of water is added into the tub, it will hold the water to that temp. Did not work. Wish I would have returned. But opened product in feb, being this was an xmas gift, and daughter didn't seem to mind too much, I didn't bother messing with it. Now she never uses as she now prefers warmer water, wish I'd returned.
customer_reviews.author: Marysol Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Obviously you get what you pay for, but as far as models in this price range go it's actually pretty nice. I wish it had more than one function (bubble/heat) but not as much as I wish the jets were on the sides rather than two long thin strips that run parallel with your feet. They end up getting covered and somehow that makes them turn off. But still, heating element works and the waters nice (especially with epsom salts).
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and granted it's my first use, but I am surprised by the negative reviews. This is a pretty great product given the $ spent. I included pics of the bubbling feature. So yeah, it's not going to heat the water, but I did not really expect it to as that would require something a bit more complex. I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: ohiocat

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, too small, too cold
customer_reviews.text: This is for small women with tiny feet and who only like cold water. I am a regular sized man (10.5 size feet) and the water almost covers my feet, except then water splashes out of the back when I turn it on. Plus it does not keep water warm at all. I'm not looking to warm up cold water, just keep the hot water at a warm temperature, and it fails miserably. Just terrible. I should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: This product is mediocre. It doesn't really keep the water warm as it is advertised. The vibration is minimal but still nice. There's a weird purple knob on top that I suppose is to help massage your feet but it doesn't move at all and is pretty useless. This product is okay but next time will probably spend some more for a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for our anniversary it has Good vibration but overall lacks the basic essential purpose of keeping the water hot within 3 minutes my wife told me the water was cold. It is very disappointing to buy this gift and then it falls far off the mark in basic expectations. The foot spa if that's what you want to call it is so loud you xant hear anything while watching tv unless you turn the volume way up. I am overall disappointed in this product and would not recommend it for anyone to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy and value
customer_reviews.text: It’s a must have item. The heater isn’t effective so add warm water if that’s your preference, the vibration is relaxing and all size feet fit. Myself and my husband both enjoy using it. In hot summers, I like to add tea tree oil, cold water w ice to relax, cool down after a hot day. This also takes feet and ankle swelling down after a long day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this item but it provides NO HEAT WHATSOEVER
customer_reviews.text: This is just a fancy bucket. I wanted to like this item but it provides NO HEAT WHATSOEVER! The instructions are useless and all it does is provide a little bubbles. So if you want a machine that is INCREDIBLY LOUD and just gives a little bubbling with NO MASSAGE, feel free to WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Robert pecora

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my wife and she absolutely loves it ... and it was bought and an outstanding price ... it came as expected and my wife filled it up and plugged it in and immediately used it ...
customer_reviews.author: Shannon rogers

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, doesn't heat nor massage, but feels good still.
customer_reviews.text: First time use. Very easy to set up. I noticed other YT reviewers fail to put in enough water, so they get low bubble action. I filled mine to the max level and got good action. It's noisy! Seems to handle Epsom salt solution well. I put warm water in but it didn't really heat anything. If it does, it wouldn't be before the stated max use time of fifteen minutes. The "massager" doesn't really do anything. You're supposed to knead your foot into one of three choice attachments, i guess. For the money, i guess it's suitable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Leaves much to the imagination
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice if it held more than an inch or two of water. Water level barely covers your feet, and with the bubbles on... you better have a towel handy for the overflow of water! Water pours out of the back when bubbles are on and splashes water everywhere! Design is cheap and poorly thought out. The back has a dip in the middle that lets water flow out onto the floor, and barely holds enough water to cover your feet. Definitely returning it and buying one that’s much deeper.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special you can't even tell it vibrating unless you put pressure on your feet which defeat the purpose of it. The connecting parts don't even do anything but serve as a foot rest with spikes its uncomfortable also it suppose to have heating as well i must've received a defective one because my water is cold even though i started with warm water hoping it will get hot or hotter then it was. well I'll be sending it back waste of money. This would be negative stars but doesn't have that option so 1 disappointing star it is.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Sweet G

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly how it says it should. You get ...
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly how it says it should. You get what you pay for, for the price and read the whole description. I think a lot of other people who ordered it and reviewed it didn't read the whole description.
customer_reviews.author: Shasta Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lets be honest with ourselves, this product is amazing when you first get it. We use it, love it, spill way too much water all over our house, then put in a box and never use again. That first time use was amazing, im happy to report that its doing great tucked away in its box in my closet.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The delivery was fast...thanks
customer_reviews.text: I love this conair foot, it's perfect! My foot feel happy 🤗😘😘 thank you so much for all,for your fast delivery...
customer_reviews.author: Dina Gherciu

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend the product.
customer_reviews.text: Does not keeps water warm even you placed warm/hot steamy water. It makes too much noise also when you turn on the bubbles. It works for your pedi still but I can’t use the bubbles or I will ot be able to hear the tv or music... For a Zen pedi turn off :( the bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: Guana Me

customer_reviews.title: Good choice if you need a basic foot bath.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for price. If you need a foot basin and you want some water agitation then this is a great choice. Its a step above the standard basins but way below the price point of the higher end foot baths with the massaging rollers and sprays. For me I just wanted something that vibrated but didn't cost 85-100 dollars and this fit the bill. If you are really interested in the massaging aspect this is probably not the pick for you but if you just need some vibration then this will work.
customer_reviews.author: George F Shaffer III

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction. Works as advertised. But you probably don't need it.
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing wrong with the product. It's easy to use, and works as it's supposed to. However, now that I've been using it a while, I realized that I could have saved the money and use a simple bucket instead. They are practically the same. All those fancy functions are just gimmicks, and really you don't need them. I certainly don't feel the added benefits of having bubbles and waterfalls. So, 5 stars because they didn't lie, but I feel like I should be honest and maybe stop someone from making the same mistakes I did.
customer_reviews.author: Catdominium

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised. The heating element is only supposed to keep the water warmed and not hot. I just put hot water in it to begin with and it is not an issue. The vibration it puts off is gentle. My only issue is that the box came very damaged, which would have sucked if it was a gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Soothing!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this foot spa for my friend because her job requires her to stand on her feet for 8 hours a day. She also injured her foot and needed something to soothe the pain. She loves it! She told me how this product worked well for her and that it works exactly as it is supposed to. I'm so happy that the product met her expectations.
customer_reviews.author: CharmChats

customer_reviews.title: Heating feature not effective, otherwise excellent
customer_reviews.text: This foot bath is an excellent product for it's price. The vibrating function works well, and is deep and big enough for all sizes of feet. The only reason i'm not listing it at a higher rating is because the heating function does not seem to work at all. The manual indicates that the heating portion is only intended to maintain the temperature, not actually bring cold water to a warm state. However, it doesn't appear to even do this. warm water turns cold even with the heating function on.
customer_reviews.author: Whimsicalknight

customer_reviews.title: Okay Product
customer_reviews.text: Size is good for my husband’s large feet but this bath does not keep the water warm as the package indicated. Very disappointed with that part.
customer_reviews.author: james jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Foot Spa- waterfall, bubbles and light!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this especially since I'm not going to get pedicures due to Covid19. The only thing I didn't like is that in the center there is this roller thing meant for massage however you need to move your feet back and forth to get the massage. And you can remove the rollers however then the brackets make it uncomfortable, just a design flaw. But overall very pleased with this product. What foot spa has a waterfall so cool. Doesn't keep the water very warm but I didn't expect it to, as I've had these before.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Conde-Helman

customer_reviews.title: But it was comfortable, easy to hook up and clean
customer_reviews.text: This unit is okay... As other reviews stated, it is louder than desirable, and I didn't notice the "heat" control keeping the water warm at all. I opted for the bubbles to be off just so I could relax without the noise. But it was comfortable, easy to hook up and clean. Overall happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amie N.

customer_reviews.title: it's just a bucket that vibrates honestly
customer_reviews.text: I thought i could do without the bubbles and just buy something cheap, but no. I need something that keeps the water warm and makes bubbles. I was not satisfied with just vibrations it was a waste. You mind as well go to the dollar tree or 99 cent store and buy a pan because this thing doesn't do anything special.
customer_reviews.author: Fancy-pntz

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It’s so loud for no reason, you barely feel the vibrations and the water cools down fairly quick even though it’s supposed to “maintain the water temperature”. The sound is sooo annoying !!
customer_reviews.author: Aliyah

customer_reviews.title: 5 feet comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected for the price. Is kind of loud, but again... it works as expected for the price. Keeps already warm water to temperature, does not heat the water. Fits my boyfriends size 10.5 feet comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Whittington

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT recommend this product and I am very disappointed. I love the waterfall feature, but the bubbles option is SO loud. I put a towel underneath to see if that would absorb some of the sound but it didn’t help. The noise is unbearably loud. It sounds like a loud motor. Sounds like it is going to take off. I didn’t expect this from a foot spa. Also disappointed that the middle piece doesn’t spin like most foot spa pumices. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: natalie ann parker

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: I misunderstood the description of the device. I thought the center tool was pressure sensitive, that would allow for a pumice stone like quality for your feet. However, this feature is stationary. The vibration of the water is nice. The is supposed to be maintained at the temperature of the water placed into the machine. The water did not maintain it's temperature. However, when combined with other products, such as the tea tree oil salts & the callus removal, I am very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: joy

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t trying to buy something that was expensive. It does what I need it to. The vibration isn’t very strong at all but it’s there and I know it’s not supposed to warm your water for you but instead keep it warm which it doesn’t do a very good job at. So I make sure the waters nice and hot it stays warm for about 20 min. Overall I like this product or myself, for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Darienne

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I finally bought one of these! Such a great price! Great for soaking sore feet and love the little vibration as well. After wearing heels all day it’s nice to come home and soak my feet while I watch tv, read etc.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: This thing has rarely been used because it hurts. Either I let my legs rest naturally and it pressed painfully into my angle bone or I hold my legs together and my inner muscles slowly start to feel the burn. I don't wan the exercise when I am trying to rest my feet. I am looking for a replacement and this will go in the trash or maybe be donated to a family member with really thin thighs.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: It’s bliss 😌
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read a lot of other people’s comments, but this is an all out win! The bubbles feel amazing, the light is cool as hell, the waterfall give make sure is that your whole foot is just getting like the attention it deserves! Like I don’t think any machine maintains heat but duck it, just add more hot water and stop being lazy!
customer_reviews.author: sydney

customer_reviews.title: Noisey
customer_reviews.text: It's feel good on my feet but the noise is horrendous! The motor is the loudest motor I've ever heard. I do not recommend this. The massage gadget does not do anything. Not even a vibration. The bubbles are great - but have to either wear earplugs or watch TV and make it loud. Should not be advertised as a massager. The foot bath part and the bubble are great but I feel like sending it back for the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Mariu

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with this one.
customer_reviews.text: Unhappy. Not sure why there is even a motor in this. It serves zero purpose amd is really not big enough for larger feet. Not comfy for feet larger than 8 ladies or 9 mens.
customer_reviews.author: Gayla Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little foot spa! I use this when my feet are in pain after a long day at work. The vibration is just okay but for the price I can't really complain. Keep in mind that you need to pour warm/hot water in here as it does not warm it up for you. Otherwise its a great product for at home use.
customer_reviews.author: Christine C.

customer_reviews.title: Great vibration
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time and I am so glad I got it. I didn’t want anything crazy fancy, just a little massage. It has great vibration strength. Please be aware that the HEAT doesn’t mean it heats up the water. It’s just maintains the heat of the water you add to it. It’s very roomie as well. I’m a size 10/11 women and had more than enough room.
customer_reviews.author: Ebony

customer_reviews.title: It works but it’s loud
customer_reviews.text: The machine overall works really good given the fact that you pour water and your own salts. The machine is very loud you can’t really use it around others unless you don’t mind bothering them it has a vibrating/heat selection but I just feel the vibrating portion of that the cleaning process is probably the sameFor all foot baths but it is just too bulky so I have to clean it in the tub
customer_reviews.author: delashia genaro

customer_reviews.title: Ok product, water spills allover
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to use Massage mode is good More of a fun product , kids and adults can use Got few attachments Low price Cons: Water spills all over Does not hold heat longer I would not highly recommend buying this , I think better to spend few more bucks and get another one
customer_reviews.author: s&p

customer_reviews.title: Dont do it
customer_reviews.text: I wasted my money in this thing and dont want anyone else to lose out, the water didn't even stay remotely warm after 4 minutes and the bubbles stopped working on 1 side only after 1 use.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Oxley-Parker

customer_reviews.title: This product does not heat or keep water warm
customer_reviews.text: Everything was awesome except for the fact that it does not warm water or heat it wish I knew that before the return time expired bought it in January just opened it since we are in quarantine there’s nothing to do wanted to do a pedicure but water was so cold even warm water got cold, there’s a button that says heat, bubbles, vibrate & light.
customer_reviews.author: janette

customer_reviews.title: More of a novelty that anything else
customer_reviews.text: For $32 or whatever it was, it's not a terrible spend because it does have bubbles and a waterfall and it's definitely nice, but the water heater is so poor, the water temp, once cooled down, is luke warm at best. If you put cold water in, I don't think it would heat it up to luke warm. For $30, it's not the end of the world, but I was expecting something with a little more heat and a little more utility.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Baltime

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price range.
customer_reviews.text: I got my foot spa today and was excited to use it immediately. I set it up and add some Epsom salt and essential oils. After turning it on I realized the vibration isn’t extremely strong and it’s very loud. The heating doesn’t work at all but it did keep my water warm enough for 20 minutes. Overall I like this foot spa and it’s good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job. Great for beginners or at home.
customer_reviews.text: I think this is just great for a beginner or at home use. The vibration and heat are not all that powerful. The heat just keeps the water warm, doesn't warm it up. It's very plain and easy to use. Cleaning it however is a little rough mainly because of the model. But works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzmine Mills

customer_reviews.title: It's Alright?
customer_reviews.text: There are no moving parts for this. There is one vibration, underneath lots of tiny bumps. To really get anything out of it, I have to continuously readjust my footing. The additional "massage point" has no vibration, and is too firm to be useful. It has a similar texture to a plastic comb. The water doesn't stay hot. There is no way to adjust temperature, there is only one setting. I was really hoping for a game changer, but I'm very underwhelmed. I can't see myself using this again, it hasn't done much for my pain. It's just alright.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to soak feet.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works well. You will need to preheat your water before using the device. The heating element does not keep the water as warm as I would like but it is still a quality product for the price. I would recommend getting a higher quality unit if tempature control is important to you other wise this is a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Terry

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your time
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t really do anything...lol it has different tabs to use and it bubbles, but doesn’t massage or keep water warm I threw it out
customer_reviews.author: R. Montesano

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it - just face the music and get one more expensive
customer_reviews.text: Pretty useless. The vibration just makes noise, nothing more. Even my wife’s tiny feet cannot he moved even slightly by the vibration. I guess they say there is heat too?? If there is, it doesn’t have heating capacity needed at all lol it’s littlerally just a tub to put your feet in which you can get from Walmart for cheaper, and bigger, thus it won’t spill everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Энди фокс

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother in law because scrubbing her feet is hard for her and she loves it. Says its easy to use and clean out and happy that I got her this one.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, EXTREMELY UNCOMFORTABLE. WARNING !
customer_reviews.text: One of the most uncomfortable Foot Tubs I ever used in my Life! The 2 small blue pieces inside of the Foot Tub feels extremely uncomfortable. My feet wasn't covered with water, & the water still runs out the back of the Foot tub. Foot tub don't have it's own separate heat button. Overpriced & a waste of money ! I want my Money back, this thing don't even vibrate. Just a regular Foot tub, just wayyy more uncomfortable !!
customer_reviews.author: Variety4Sales

customer_reviews.title: No heat, and too powerful bubbles
customer_reviews.text: I could have just gotten a foot soaking tub for half the price. Heater does not work. The bubbles work so well that that with the container only a third full of water and still the bubbles cause enough splashing to soak the floor all around this thing and most of my calves.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for my wife... Don't let the fancy talk suck you in.. it does very little. It's basically like running your feet over a tub faucet. Vibration is non existing, I've seen kids blow more bubbles in their juice boxes than this thing puts out. Noisy as hell, the lights have an 80s night club feel. All around a cheap product. I mainly blame myself for buying this product. For just a little more money there is alot more out there way better than this turd.
customer_reviews.author: tony p.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Fall For This Product
customer_reviews.text: I should have believed the reviews on this product when I read them. I believe that they made this product to be visually appealing enough to get those on the fence to buy it and it worked! The review I read that said, "It is not better than a bucket" was correct. It is a nice sized foot bucket with an electrical cord to make it vibrate. No bubbles and no foot massage. I would have sent it back if my husband hadn't thrown away the box.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: An excellent foot spa for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I've had one for years, definitely helped my feet after a hard day in the oil field. When my son was diagnosed with plantar fasciitis, I had him try mine. Hot water and Epsom Salt and he immediately felt relief. So I ordered one for him to have at his house.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Z.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My mom starts having some trouble with sleeping, so I bought this for my mom to soak her feet with Epsom salt everyday night. Its light and has cute color. With this price, I dont expect it to keep the water warm for a long time, but the water does get cool pretty fast. The vibration works well in the first few days, but it starts making noise so much after, so my mom doesn't turn it on anymore. Overall, it's a great product for its price. It is suitable for what we need. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Unsure about buying one of these things?  This will do.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting one of these for years, but was unsure about buying one at $80. Was it going to be something that I barely use? So I thought- wow!- an affordable model! Worth a shot. This way if I don't like it- it wasn't a huge loss. For the price, it's not terrible. It does NOT heat the water, but the bubbles are soothing. And it is noisy, but that doesn't bother me too much. If you put warm/hot water in and Epson salt, it's pretty soothing. It has convinced me that purchasing a higher quality one in the future is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Taco dude

customer_reviews.title: Zero Stars!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't order this. We got one, returned it because the heat does not maintain AT ALL. The replacement they sent also doesn't keep the heat level up. You put HEAT on the name of the product and it doesn't heat!!!! Don't say it has HEAT if it doesn't! I gave this as a gift and I'm really embarrassed and angry! False claims mean you are selling these illegally. Lies in advertisements are illegal. Without heat, this is useless garbage. NO HEAT means my sister could have made her own foot bath in her own bath tub! So angry right now! Don't buy this or you will be sorry. Waste of money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget S.

customer_reviews.title: water does not stay heated
customer_reviews.text: I was going to return this but unfortunately discovered that even the more expensive units have the same issues. The vibration massage feature is decent, It will be VERY LOUD until you position your feet and the pressure just right. The water will NOT stay heated. Their customer service will tell you that it stays warm for about 15 minutes from the time you pour it in the unit. Call me crazy, but I'm pretty sure that happens with a regular bucket of hot water too...
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Falls short of the mark
customer_reviews.text: The bubbles are nice. The waterfall is nice. It works. It's large enough for my feet. But, either the heater doesn't function or it's pathetic because extremely hot water reaches room temp in less than 10 minutes. I know it's not meant to heat water, but it is meant to keep warm water at least somewhat warm. This fails pathetically at that. It's not relaxing needing to wipe your feet off every 3 minutes to get more hot water.
customer_reviews.author: Lefko

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: This is just an over-priced bucket. It is EXTREMELY loud and the bubbles make the water cold almost instantly. I can't even tell if the heat even does anything. Maybe keeps the water a few degrees above room temp, but it wont keep warm water warm. Possibly defective? The construction is the exact same thickness as a cheap plastic mop bucket. And don't let the scrubbie pads influence you because if you really apply any pressure you'll tip the bucket. Its very easy to tip.
customer_reviews.author: john libby

customer_reviews.title: Good foot bath, no heat.
customer_reviews.text: Vibration definetly there, but seemed to fade in & out... heat... there’s no heat, the instructions state “The heat setting is designed to maintain the temperature of warm water, not to heat water.” I am disappointed in that... however I did enjoy a soothing foot bath after work today.
customer_reviews.author: angel greathouse

customer_reviews.title: R.I.P. cheap machine
customer_reviews.text: Heating does not work. I had to fill it with hot water. The machine PASSED AWAY tonight, the only function of vibration stopped working after using less than 10 times. I should have not expect too much for this cheap machine.
customer_reviews.author: Shihoshi Y.

customer_reviews.title: What a joke
customer_reviews.text: What a joke I purchased this product in Dec 2018 I am trying to purchase another one no way I am going to pay over $70 this is ridiculous. They know ppl are buy more now due to the quarantine. I understand products prices change over time but no way it is 6 times the value
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Y

customer_reviews.title: It shocked me - doesnt heat water -dont waste your $$
customer_reviews.text: The description is misleading it does not "heat" it only maintains the level of heat od the water that is put it in (per the manuel i side) however it even does a poor job at at that. The first one i had i had to return because the waterfall was faulty. The new one shipped pretty quickly. We plugged it in and it started blinking and shocked me! We requested a refund but it said the refund was $0 since it based it off the 2nd received one. Definitely not happy with this product. Do not waste your money. I would give zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Bridgette

customer_reviews.title: Pedicure Spa
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I enjoys it, I use it to relax my feet after a long day of work and my wife uses it to do her own pedicures which leaves her feet looking nice and leaves my feet feeling good. Does exactly what it states in the description and will continue to use!
customer_reviews.author: Kaevon P.

customer_reviews.title: Its ok...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool, love the waterfall effect...the bubbles are big...a little too big even on the low setting....glad I was outside cause the water spilled out all over the place. It definitely did not "heat" my little feetsies like I had hoped it would on the heat/bubble setting but it's good for the price. I would definitely splurge a little more on a higher end quality if you're looking for a more spa experience. This was cute but not amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Alejandra Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw leads to no bubbles
customer_reviews.text: Simply put. What bubbles? Think it’s a design flaw. Not made for bigger feet. . The blue bubble strip gets blocked by foot placement and it’s not strong enough to produce bubbles until you lift your feet which defects the purpose. Returned
customer_reviews.author: jlk

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can't beat it. It does not keep the water warm I started with super hot water and within 30 minutes the water wasn't even like warm. However I was using a plastic tub before so the heat wasn't a deal breaker but I wish it would keep the water warm. The bubbles work great though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Witmer

customer_reviews.title: Not too impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not big enough if your feet are any larger than a women's size 10 (men's 8 or 9). Also, the heater is not terribly strong and it does NOT maintain the temperature of the water. Vibration is not strong enough. Okay for soaking pre-pedicure, not so much if you have any sort of foot problem (fasciitis, arthritis). Not bad, but I definitely wish I'd spent another twenty bucks and gotten a better quality machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: which is awesome for a germaphobe like me haha
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you REALLY can't beat this! No need to worry about jets to clean out, which is awesome for a germaphobe like me haha. The heater on it isn't great, so I just fill it with hot water and let it keep it warm. I use often with Epsom salts and essential oils like lavender, peppermint, and tea tree oil for fresh, happy toesies ;)
customer_reviews.author: FiFi Shops

customer_reviews.title: A little too loud and attachments are manual
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit loud for my taste, so didn't find it relaxing. I used my tablet with headset on the second use which helped. Also, none of the extras are auto, so I had to manually use the pumice etc., for which I didn't need to purchase this unit. Primarily I liked it for the waterfall and bubbles feature. Didn't care for the LED (initially I thought it was cool feature to have but once I used it, seemed redundant). I liked that the water was warm and didn't get cold. Didn't really like that the attachments including the rollers are manual. Felt like extra effort and between that and the noise, didn't exactly get the spa feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Shikha M

customer_reviews.title: ahhhh ur feet will thank you
customer_reviews.text: my friend bought this for hear self. amazon does not ship to my area anymore so i had to send it 3 hours away and drive to get it. the road trip was fun i give u that. she was so excited we have been looking for mouths to find them up here in the stores this is a very small town so i thought of amazon. it lights up has heat and does what it says it does . she should me her feet they did look much better them before., so if u live in a small town like i look now father for foot bath. ur feet will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Morrigan

customer_reviews.title: Great vibrator
customer_reviews.text: So this product only retains the heat of hot water added, however doesn't keep warm for long. It's very noisy, but it does it's vibrating job, it's definitely stronger than my previous one. It sure does relax my feet and I'm happy and content with that.
customer_reviews.author: Maricel_JaneM

customer_reviews.title: Gifted...they can’t complain
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift! Who doesn’t like a nice pedicure and foot spa? I mean, doesn’t come with the person doing the pedicure but if you’re a self-starter this would be great. Also, this is very much needed during coronavirus.
customer_reviews.author: Kale

customer_reviews.title: Nice Buy
customer_reviews.text: The vibration strength was surprisingly stronger than what I expected and although it doesn't really heat up if you fill it with hot/warm water it'll do just fine. I bought this as a gift for my grandmother and she also loves how wide it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi bella

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing despite what I seen in the reviews hoping at least the vibration would be good. I would have been better buying a foot bucket. This thing is very loud, did not keep water warm, vibration also sucked. All I heard was a bunch of loud annoying noise. Complete waste of money and space in closet.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: neat concept. Motor is loud though
customer_reviews.text: I'm not surprised about the quality for the price but it gets what I need done. The motor is very loud and the vibration is not too strong but comfortable. The cord could be longer so I could have more freedom to set up wherever I want in my living room. Overall I'm satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Works well, little loud, doesn’t warm water but still recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. A little loud (but I don’t care) and disappointed I did not see it doesn’t warm the water or keep it warm but for my purposes and just using it on myself as a treat, using boiling water and soaking as it cools is more than enough to relax and enjoy. If you don’t mind either of these things it’s perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Did what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a teenager to encourage her to take better care of her feet. The smell from her feet used to be horrific. Now after several months of use adding mouthwash to the water no more odor.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Voss

customer_reviews.title: Just blah...
customer_reviews.text: This product sounded like what we were looking for. However, we used it this evening for the first time. The instructions do not match the product. It does not have a warm setting. Within 2 mins my water was ice cold which I assume is from the water bubbling. And the vibration is pretty much just blah. No various settings, just one single setting for both bubbles and vibration. I guess you get what you pay for but we were not impressed. I never leave reviews but this product is just blah. We are sending it back and hope to get a better model.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Graves

customer_reviews.title: Could really be improved.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. It’s decent and has nice features but has a lower lip at the back that presents a big spill risk. Can’t rub your feet on the rollers with any good amount of water in it bc it splashes out the back. The waterfall is nice but it makes the water cold in about <5min? This thing having a heater is a joke- I had to dump the water 3 times trying to keep it warm and I used it for such a short time (bc it keep getting cold).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cold water and soggy feet
customer_reviews.text: Was super excited and showed all my friends. I returned it after a week. Pros: Bubbles, waterfall, low/high settings for bubble, cool rave lighting Cons: DOESNT HEAT SO YOUR FEET AS SOAKED IN COLD WATER AFTER 1 MINUTE! It was alright, if you're bored. But don't expect it to actually massage your feet after a hard day! I read all reviews and this was the cheapest and well rated, but you get what you paid for! Don't recommend because cold water is never relaxing. Aside from the temperature, everything is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nisa Farhana

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The vibration isn’t that sting but I don’t be mind because I didn’t get it for that function anyways. I just needed a basic way to soak my feet. Works exactly how I need it to.
customer_reviews.author: Myranda

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: This product states it has a heat feature which maintains the temperature of the water you put but it's not true. I put very hot water and it turns cold within minutes. I am disappointed in this product. I bought this for my mom since she had back surgery and can't make her way to the salon for a pedicure. I would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: THE BUBBLING FEATURE IS JUST THAT MORE LIKE A FISH TANK THAN A JACUZZI DOES NOT NOTICEABLY ...
customer_reviews.text: SIZE 13 FEET JUST FIT IN IT, DOES NOT EVEN KEEP WATER WARM I PLACE HOT WATER IN IT AND 10 MINUTES LATER IT IS COLD. THE BUBBLING FEATURE IS JUST THAT MORE LIKE A FISH TANK THAN A JACUZZI DOES NOT NOTICEABLY HELP IN ANY WAY
customer_reviews.author: Paul Zucker

customer_reviews.title: Great product except it does not keep the water hot
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great item however I’m only getting three stars because the heater does not seem to work and it would be great if it actually kept the water warm for a little while. I find that the water is cold to play within 10 to 15 minutes
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like this pedi basin, easy to clean n perfect sz, the only downside is , you can barely feel the vibration and its kinda loud in my opinion. I just used it to soak my feet without turning the vibration on.
customer_reviews.author: Melti You

customer_reviews.title: Water gets cold fast
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mom. The description says the water will stay warm. She often has cold feet so thought this would be a great gift. Have exchanged several times because we thought it might be a malfunction of just one product but the water still gets cold super fast. Great if you want a foot ice bath.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

product_meta.title: Conair Active Life Waterfall Foot Spa with Lights and Bubbles, Blue
product_meta.description: Style:Blue| Color:Waterfall / Lights / BubblesPamper your feet with a rejuvenating massage and spa experience at home! The Conair Active Life Waterfall Foot Spa comforts your feet in warm relaxation. Specially designed for active lifestyles, the flowing waterfall gently massages the top of the feet while the massaging foot rollers soothe the soles. Exfoliating loofah disks help soften skin and provide a rejuvenating massage, while LED lights showcase massage bubble action with heat to ensure water stays warm. With this foot bath tub, it’s easy to take good care of one of the hardest working parts of your body! Most of us are on our feet a lot! That’s a lot of stress and strain on a daily basis. Compound that with activity and how much love do you give your feet? With each foot’s 26 bones, 20-plus muscles and over 100 ligaments, it’s no wonder that happy feet can affect your overall well-being. The toe-touch push buttons on this pedicure foot spa make it easy to control bubbles, waterfall feature and temperature for a customized experience every time. This foot massager includes 3 attachments: a pumice stone to gently exfoliate skin for smooth feet, a scrub brush to gently clean feet and a soft-touch massager to relax achy, sore feet. Whether you want to soak in cool, warm or hot water, this spa is especially designed to maintain the temperature you choose. Water jets propel water over and around your foot, providing a massaging effect that helps your muscles relax. The massaging foot spa also has a “waterfall” feature which gently pours water over the top of your feet for utter relaxation. With the Conair Active Life Waterfall Foot Spa with Lights and Bubbles, your feet will always be pampered and revitalized. This footbath will not keep the water warm; you must put warm water into the footbath and expect it to cool off after around 10 minutes. We do not say anywhere on the detail page that it will hear and/or keep water warm. Keep the water at 100 to 118 degrees fahrenheit to avoid burning your skin.
feature_bullets: 3 toe-touch push-buttons activate bubbles, waterfall and heat
3 attachments: scrub brush, pumice stone and soft-touch massager
Exfoliating loofah discs soften skin and provides rejuvenation
Massaging foot rollers soothe the soles of tired feet
LED lights showcase massage bubble action with heat

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
